chapter.title: Anthologies and Contributions to Anthologies
chapter.para: An anthology typically does not have an author, but one or more editors, a title, a place and time of publication and an extent in number of pages or volumes.
Again, an anthology does not have to occur inside something else, but it can: it can be part of a series, and here it follows the pattern of the book.

If "articles" are publications that occur inside periodicals, let us then say that anthologies consist of "anthology contributions." An anthology contribution has one or more authors and a title and then it occurs inside an anthology: here one usually notes the title of the anthology, its editor(s), its place and time of publication, and finishes off with the location of the contribution inside the anthology.
We see here the same three-division structure that we noted in relation to the book inside a series.
